heisig_chinese_memo: When someone you know who is normally talkative goes quiet, it's usually a sign that they are contending with the blues.

humanum_full_description_en:
Bronze inscriptions from " green ", " strength ", " green " and " struggle " are all sound symbols, and the ancient rhymes of " green ", " struggle " and " quiet " are the same. Liu Hongtao pointed out that " quiet " is the first article of " cultivation ", and its original meaning is coupled farming, that is, two people farming together. Zhang Shichao believes that " contention " is a symbol of righteousness, and " quietness " means peace without contention, so let's talk about it.

In addition to being used as a person's name, Bronze inscriptions can be used in two ways: one, be quiet, and learn from Gui: "The death of the people (no) is not healthy." The second is to calm down and calm down. Later classics are often written as " Jing ", Ban Gui: "Three years of Jingdong or (country)", and Qin Gonggui: "Calm but not court, reverence for me."

" Jing " in bronze or just "青", see "青". In the bamboo and silk scripts from the Warring States Period to the Han Dynasty, " Jing " was again read as " Zheng ", "Shangbo Chu Zhushu. "Benevolence": "Benevolence (ren) is good, then (benevolence) is also quiet (competing) first." "Mawangdui Han Silk Book. "Lao Zi Jia Ben": "The husband is not quiet, so there is no special." The second edition and the general edition are both " competitive ".

In addition, " Jing " is the same as "竫", the word " Jing " is made "竫" in the ancient Chinese bamboo slips, Qin Gongpiao: "Jing Gong", "Historical Records. "Qin Benji" as "Long Gong".

"Shuowen": "Quiet, trial. Congqing contends for sound." Duan Yucai's note: "The original word for quiet should be from Libu Zhiling."
humanum_short_description_en: Synopsis: The inscription " Jing " from " Qing " and " Zheng " are both sound symbols. Liu Hongtao pointed out that " Jing " is the first article of " cultivation ", which refers to coupling farming (two people together farming), borrowed as " jing ". Zhang Shichao believes that " quiet " means peace without contention.
humanum_full_description:
金文從「青」、「爭」，「青」、「爭」皆是聲符，「青」、「爭」、「靜」古韻同。劉洪濤指出「靜」是「耕」的初文，本義是耦耕，即二人並耕。張世超認為「爭」是義符，「靜」即是無爭而安，聊備一說。

　　金文除用作人名外，用法有二：一，安靜，師訇簋：「民亡(無)不康靜」。二，鎮撫、平定，後世典籍多作「靖」，班簋：「三年靜東或(國)」，秦公簋：「鎮靜不廷，虔敬朕祀」。

　　「靜」金文或只寫作「青」，參見「青」。戰國至漢的簡帛書中，「靜」又通讀為「爭」，《上博楚竹書．緇衣》：「上好(仁)，則下之為(仁)也靜(爭)先」。《馬王堆漢帛書．老子甲本》：「夫唯不靜，故无尤」，乙本及通行本皆作「爭」。

　　此外，「靜」同「竫」，「靜」字汗簡古文作「竫」，秦公鎛：「靜公」，《史記．秦本紀》作「竫公」。

　　《說文》：「靜，審也。从青爭聲。」段玉裁注：「安靜本字當从立部之竫。」
humanum_short_description: 金文「靜」從「青」、「爭」，皆是聲符，劉洪濤指出「靜」是「耕」的初文，指耦耕（二人合耕），借為「靜」。張世超認為「靜」即是無爭而安。

  • ⿰ Left to right
    • 青 [ qīng ] nature's color; blue, green, black; young

①停止的，與“動”相對：靜止。靜態。靜物。平靜。風平浪靜。
②沒有聲音：安靜。寂靜。僻靜。冷靜。肅靜。靜悄悄。靜穆。靜謐。靜默。靜觀。靜聽。
③安詳，閒雅：靜心。靜坐。
④古同“淨”，清潔。
⑤姓氏。

金文從「 青 」、「 爭 」，「 青 」、「 爭 」皆是聲符，「 青 」、「 爭 」、「 靜 」古韻同。劉洪濤指出「 靜 」是「 耕 」的初文，本義是耦耕，即二人並耕。張世超認為「 爭 」是義符，「 靜 」即是無爭而安，聊備一說。 金文除用作人名外，用法有二：一，安靜，師訇簋：「民亡(無)不康靜」。二，鎮撫、平定，後世典籍多作「 靖 」，班簋：「三年靜東或(國)」，秦公簋：「鎮靜不廷，虔敬朕祀」。 「 靜 」金文或只寫作「 青 」，參見「 青 」。戰國至漢的簡帛書中，「 靜 」又通讀為「 爭 」，《上博楚竹書．緇衣》：「上好(仁)，則下之為(仁)也靜(爭)先」。《馬王堆漢帛書．老子甲本》：「夫唯不靜，故无尤」，乙本及通行本皆作「 爭 」。 此外，「 靜 」同「 竫 」，「 靜 」字汗簡古文作「 竫 」，秦公鎛：「靜公」，《史記．秦本紀》作「竫公」。 《說文》：「靜，審也。从青爭聲。」段玉裁注：「安靜本字當从立部之竫。」
Bronze inscriptions from " green", " strength", " green" and " struggle" are all sound symbols, and the ancient rhymes of " green", " struggle" and " quiet" are the same. Liu Hongtao pointed out that " quiet" is the first article of " cultivation", and its original meaning is coupled farming, that is, two people farming together. Zhang Shichao believes that " contention" is a symbol of righteousness, and " quietness" means peace without contention, so let's talk about it. In addition to being used as a person's name, Bronze inscriptions can be used in two ways: one, be quiet, and learn from Gui: "The death of the people (no) is not healthy." The second is to calm down and calm down. Later classics are often written as " Jing", Ban Gui: "Three years of Jingdong or (country)", and Qin Gonggui: "Calm but not court, reverence for me." " Jing" in bronze or just " 青", see " 青". In the bamboo and silk scripts from the Warring States Period to the Han Dynasty, " Jing" was again read as " Zheng", "Shangbo Chu Zhushu. "Benevolence": "Benevolence (ren) is good, then (benevolence) is also quiet (competing) first." "Mawangdui Han Silk Book. "Lao Zi Jia Ben": "The husband is not quiet, so there is no special." The second edition and the general edition are both " competitive". In addition, " Jing" is the same as " 竫", the word " Jing" is made " 竫" in the ancient Chinese bamboo slips, Qin Gongpiao: "Jing Gong", "Historical Records. "Qin Benji" as "Long Gong". "Shuowen": "Quiet, trial. Congqing contends for sound." Duan Yucai's note: "The original word for quiet should be from Libu Zhiling."

靜字的基本解释

靜
jìng
同“静”。

靜字的汉语字典释义

[①]［jìng］
［《廣韻》疾郢切，上静，從。］
“靜1”的新字形。
(1)静止；不动。
(2)寂静，无声。
(3)默不作声。
(4)安静；平静。
(5)谓使安定。
(6)沉着，冷静。
(7)沉静稳重。
(8)清洁，干净。
(9)清洗，清除。
(10)净尽，没有馀剩。
(11)精神贯注专一。道家一种修养之术。
(12)倦怠。
(13)即坛静。道家修炼处所。参见“静房”、“静櫺”。
(14)善美。
(15)引申为巧饰，巧伪。
(16)图谋。
(17)精明。参见“静悍”。
(18)通“情”。诚实。
(19)通“情”。内心，内情。
(20)通“争”。

靜字的康熙字典解释

【戌集中】【青字部】　靜； 康熙笔画：16； 页码：页1382第03
〔古文〕㣏【唐韻】【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】?疾郢切，音穽。【說文】審也。从靑，爭聲。【註】徐鍇曰：丹靑明審也。　又【增韻】動之對也。【易·坤卦】至靜而德方。　又【書·堯典】靜言庸違。【傳】靜，謀也。　又【詩·邶風】靜言思之。【傳】靜，安也。又【鄭風】琴瑟在御，莫不靜好。　又【詩·邶風】靜女其姝。【傳】靜，貞靜也。　又【廣韻】息也。【禮·月令】百官靜事毋?。　又【韻會】澄也。　又【廣韻】和也。　又【韻會】通作靖。亦通作靚。亦通作竫。　又【韻會】【正韻】?疾正切，音淨。義同。【前漢·揚雄傳】京師爲之語曰：維寂寞自投閣，爰淸靜作符命。　又【詩·大雅】籩豆靜嘉。【箋】潔淸而美。【釋文】淸，如字，又才性反。淸靜皆可讀去聲。◎按玉篇、廣韻、集韻、類篇，靜字皆無去聲。韻會始收入敬韻，正韻因之。考大雅、釋文，及揚雄傳京師語，靜字本可讀去聲，但韻會引解嘲爰淸爰靜句，云，顏註合韻，音才性切，則謬甚。解嘲云，爰淸爰靜，游神之庭。卽音才性切，如何與庭叶，是必因爰淸靜句
